meanings.definition: The state of being double or twofold.
meanings.sent1: The doubleness of the mirror created an illusion of extra space in the room.
meanings.sent2: The recipe called for the doubleness of ingredients to make a larger cake.
meanings.sent3: The magician used the doubleness of the mirror to trick the audience into seeing two of him.
meanings.sent4: Her smile had a doubleness to it, hiding both joy and sadness.
meanings.sent5: The doubleness of the rainbow after the rainstorm was a beautiful sight.

meanings.definition: The quality or characteristic of being deceitful or hypocritical.
meanings.sent1: His doubleness was revealed when he promised one thing but did the opposite.
meanings.sent2: The politician's doubleness was evident in his conflicting statements.
meanings.sent3: The fox's doubleness in pretending to be a friend while planning mischief was clever.
meanings.sent4: Her doubleness in pretending to like the gift while actually disliking it was hard to detect.
meanings.sent5: The doubleness of the spy's actions made it hard to trust him.
